fullProgramDescription: Students select an adviser from each department and complete a minimum of 12 upper division units in Linguistics and a minimum of 20 upper division units in Spanish & Portuguese. Students must satisfy the requirements for both majors as well as the College and University requirements.
shortProgramDescription: The interdepartmental program in Linguistics and Spanish is designed for students who are interested in the linguistic structure of Spanish, the history of the Spanish language, and/or Spanish sociolinguistics.
classHighlights: Students take core courses in Linguistics such as Introduction to Linguistics, Phonetics and Phonology, Morphology, and Syntax.
Courses in Spanish & Portuguese may include Spanish Language and Culture, Advanced Spanish Grammar, and Spanish Phonetics and Phonology.
The program allows students to explore the linguistic aspects of the Spanish language and its cultural context.
Upper division courses in both departments provide a deeper understanding of linguistic theories and Spanish language structures.
Students are encouraged to take courses that combine the study of language and culture, such as Sociolinguistics and Discourse Analysis.
learningOutcomes: Understand the fundamental principles of linguistics and their application to the Spanish language.
Analyze the linguistic structure of Spanish, including phonetics, phonology, morphology, and syntax.
Demonstrate knowledge of the history and cultural context of the Spanish language.
Apply linguistic theories to the study of Spanish language and culture.
Develop critical thinking and analytical skills in the study of language.
creditRequirements: Total of 180 quarter units; specific requirements include a minimum of 12 upper division units in Linguistics and 20 upper division units in Spanish & Portuguese
additionalInformation: Students must satisfy the requirements for both the Linguistics and Spanish & Portuguese majors, as well as the College and University requirements. Advising is available in both departments.
